entry.title: Talk:Mining
entry.summary:
Mining experience-gain missing: new section

← Older revision Revision as of 22:07, 29 March 2025
Line 56: Line 56:
 
[[User:Highshaper|Highshaper]] ([[User talk:Highshaper|talk]]) 02:51, 7 August 2022 (UTC)
 
[[User:Highshaper|Highshaper]] ([[User talk:Highshaper|talk]]) 02:51, 7 August 2022 (UTC)
 
:It may have been a delayed notification from the previous day... nothing about foraging should give mining XP that I know of. [[User:Margotbean|margotbean]] ([[User talk:Margotbean|talk]]) 17:47, 7 August 2022 (UTC)
 
:It may have been a delayed notification from the previous day... nothing about foraging should give mining XP that I know of. [[User:Margotbean|margotbean]] ([[User talk:Margotbean|talk]]) 17:47, 7 August 2022 (UTC)
 +
 +
== Mining experience-gain missing ==
 +
 +
Panning does give mining xp, which isn't stated in the wiki. (Doing an no mining/farming/fighting challenge and was very surprised being notified, that I levelled mining as in the wiki it is only started as xp-gain in the foraging section) Can't tell how much, as I'm on mobile and not able to mod. [[User:Ellaine|Ellaine]] ([[User talk:Ellaine|talk]]) 22:07, 29 March 2025 (UTC)

entry.title: Modding:Migrate to Stardew Valley 1.6.16
entry.summary:
Command argument validation: tweak literal token to avoid confusion

← Older revision Revision as of 21:38, 29 March 2025
(4 intermediate revisions by the same user not shown)
Line 5: Line 5:
  
 
This page helps mod authors prepare their mods for the next game version (tentatively {{version|1.6.16|Stardew Valley 1.6.16}}), and documents some of the changes and new functionality.
 
This page helps mod authors prepare their mods for the next game version (tentatively {{version|1.6.16|Stardew Valley 1.6.16}}), and documents some of the changes and new functionality.
 +
 +
{{TOC|limit=3}}
  
 
==FAQs==
 
==FAQs==
Line 44: Line 46:
 
|}
 
|}
  
−
===[[Modding:Event data|event]] command changes===
+
===[[Modding:Event data|Event]] command changes===
 
<ol>
 
<ol>
 
<li>Added new commands:
 
<li>Added new commands:
Line 95: Line 97:
 
! description
 
! description
 
|-
 
|-
−
| <samp>skippable {{o|skip to label}}</samp>
+
| <samp>gainSkill</samp>
 +
| Added argument validation.
 +
|-
 +
| <samp>skippable</samp>
 
| Added an optional {{o|skip to label}} argument. If set, the event will jump to that label when the player clicks the skip button (see <samp>goto</samp> for more info). The last <samp>skippable</samp> command run before the player skips is applied.
 
| Added an optional {{o|skip to label}} argument. If set, the event will jump to that label when the player clicks the skip button (see <samp>goto</samp> for more info). The last <samp>skippable</samp> command run before the player skips is applied.
  
Line 131: Line 136:
  
 
In Stardew Valley 1.6.16, the game now only does this for the main game assembly to improve performance. If a mod was using <code>[InstancedStatic]</code>, it should use SMAPI's built-in [[Modding:Modder Guide/APIs/Utilities#Per-screen data|per-screen data]] utility instead.
 
In Stardew Valley 1.6.16, the game now only does this for the main game assembly to improve performance. If a mod was using <code>[InstancedStatic]</code>, it should use SMAPI's built-in [[Modding:Modder Guide/APIs/Utilities#Per-screen data|per-screen data]] utility instead.
 +
 +
===EventValidator===
 +
====Overview====
 +
The new <samp>EventValidator</samp> class analyses [[Modding:Event data|event scripts]] to detect issues like...
 +
* command names which don't match a registered command or alias;
 +
* command arguments which don't match those expected by the command;
 +
* and custom rule violations based on <samp>validator.CommandValidators</samp> (e.g. a default validator checks that <samp>goto</samp> commands match a valid label).
 +
 +
This is mainly meant to implement unit tests for events. For example, to validate all events in a data asset:
 +
<syntaxhighlight lang="c#">
 +
string assetName = "Data/Events/Farm";
 +
var events = Game1.content.Load<Dictionary<string, string>>(assetName);
 +
 +
var validator = new EventValidator();
 +
foreach ((string key, string script) in events)
 +
{
 +
    foreach (var issue in validator.Validator(assetName, key, script))
 +
        Assert.Fail($"Validation failed for event '{key}': {issue.SuggestedError}.");
 +
}
 +
</syntaxhighlight>
 +
 +
====Command argument validation====
 +
Argument validation is enabled if the command's handler method has an <samp>EventArguments</samp> attribute, which defines the argument pattern using a special syntax. Each command can list multiple patterns, and it'll be considered valid if any of them matches. If the pattern is an empty string, the validator will ensure no arguments are provided.
 +
 +
For example, the default <samp>showFrame</samp> command is defined like this:
 +
<syntaxhighlight lang="c#">
 +
[EventArguments("int", "actor int bool?")]
 +
public static void ShowFrame(Event @event, string[] args, EventContext context)
 +
</syntaxhighlight>
 +
 +
An argument pattern consists of space-delimited ''tokens'', where each token defines the format for an argument. For example, <code>actor int bool?</code> has three tokens representing three arguments: an actor name, a positive integer, and an optional boolean.
 +
 +
These are the tokens recognized by the validator:
 +
{| class="wikitable"
 +
|-
 +
! token
 +
! meaning
 +
|-
 +
!colspan="2"| generic argument types
 +
|-
 +
| <samp>bool</samp>
 +
| A boolean value (<samp>true</samp> or <samp>false</samp>).
 +
|-
 +
| <samp>float</samp>
 +
| A positive number with optional decimal point (like <samp>5</samp> or <samp>0.5</samp>).
 +
|-
 +
| <samp>-float</samp>
 +
| A number with optional decimal point and optional negative sign (like <samp>5</samp>, <samp>-5</samp>, or <samp>-0.5</samp>).
 +
|-
 +
| <samp>int</samp>
 +
| A positive integer (like <samp>5</samp>).
 +
|-
 +
| <samp>-int</samp>
 +
| An integer with optional negative sign (like <samp>5</samp> or <samp>-5</samp>).
 +
|-
 +
| <samp>string</samp>
 +
| A quoted sequence of arbitrary text like <samp>"some words here"</samp>. If the argument has no quotes, this is equivalent to the <samp>word</samp> token.
 +
|-
 +
| <samp>word</samp>
 +
| A simple sequence of letters, numbers, periods, and/or underscores (usually an ID or similar value). While the command will accept quotes, they're redundant and will be rejected by the validator.
 +
|-
 +
| <samp>'...'</samp>
 +
| The literal text or regex pattern to match, like <code>'continue'</code> or <code>'[\w-]+'</code>.
 +
|-
 +
| <samp>remainder</samp>
 +
| One or more arguments of any type.
 +
|-
 +
!colspan="2"| specific string formats
 +
|-
 +
| <samp>actor</samp>
 +
| An actor name in the event format (like <samp>Abigail</samp> or <samp>Kent?</samp>).
 +
|-
 +
| <samp>assetName</samp>
 +
| An [[Modding:Common data field types#Asset name|asset name]] like <samp>Data/Achievements</samp>.
 +
|-
 +
| <samp>direction</samp>
 +
| A [[Modding:Event data#Directions|direction]] which can be specified as either a number (like <samp>0</samp>) or name (like <samp>up</samp>).
 +
|-
 +
| <samp>itemId</samp>
 +
| An [[Modding:Common data field types#Unique string ID|item ID]] which can be qualified or unqualified (like <samp>(O)MossySoup</samp> or <samp>MossySoup</samp>).
 +
|-
 +
| <samp>translationKey</samp>
 +
| A [[Modding:Common data field types#Translation key|translation key]] like <samp>Strings/Locations:SomeKey</samp>.
 +
|}
 +
 +
In addition, you can extend tokens with these indicators:
 +
* Suffix with <samp>+</samp> for repeating argument of that type. For example, <samp>int+</samp> would allow both <samp>5</samp> and <samp>5 6 7</samp>.
 +
* Suffix with <samp>?</samp> for an optional argument which can be omitted. All tokens after this token must also be optional. (You can have optional repeating arguments like <samp>int+?</samp>.)
 +
* Infix with <samp>|</samp> for a parameter which can be one of multiple types. For example <samp>int|bool</samp> will allow either integer or boolean values.
  
 
===Other breaking API changes===
 
===Other breaking API changes===

entry.title: User talk:Margotbean
entry.summary:
← Older revision Revision as of 17:39, 29 March 2025
Line 209: Line 209:
 
:This should be the case for ''all'' power books (other than animal & price catalog). If you want to open a bug report, that would be fine. In the meantime, though, the information can be applied to the [[Books]] page for all books that say "20 XP in each skill" on subsequent readings.
 
:This should be the case for ''all'' power books (other than animal & price catalog). If you want to open a bug report, that would be fine. In the meantime, though, the information can be applied to the [[Books]] page for all books that say "20 XP in each skill" on subsequent readings.
 
:I have restored the edit to the skill books section. Thanks! [[User:Margotbean|margotbean]] ([[User talk:Margotbean|talk]]) 11:49, 24 March 2025 (UTC)
 
:I have restored the edit to the skill books section. Thanks! [[User:Margotbean|margotbean]] ([[User talk:Margotbean|talk]]) 11:49, 24 March 2025 (UTC)
 +
 +
== Geode profits ==
 +
 +
Hi Margotbean,
 +
 +
It seems like you removed the profits of geodes earlier this month? Yes, geodes are not primarily meant for profit, and more for completing the museum. However, after the museum is completed, knowing whether or not it's more profitable to sell or to crack the geodes is a genuinely useful resource. I know I referenced it somewhat frequently (and I'm not alone - in fact, the reason I noticed they were gone was because somebody asked what the expected values were, and I went to check the wiki!)
 +
 +
I didn't want to just undo the edit, because it's clear you did it intentionally. However, I would love it for you to reconsider - it's useful, and I would really appreciate it if you could put it back. It was already in the trivia section; I don't see the harm in having it there.
 +
[[User:CandyNim|CandyNim]] ([[User talk:CandyNim|talk]]) 17:39, 29 March 2025 (UTC)

entry.title: Linus
entry.summary:
← Older revision Revision as of 17:32, 29 March 2025
Line 146: Line 146:
  
 
==Relationships==
 
==Relationships==
−
Linus generally considers himself an outcast of the town who feels unwelcome and misunderstood, but wishes to be accepted. He does not trust strangers or seem to socialize with many [[villagers]]. He tells [[the Player]] of incidents in which his [[tent]] was vandalized or destroyed. During [[festivals]], he is usually alone and away from the main festivities.
+
Linus generally considers himself an outcast of the town who feels unwelcome and misunderstood, but wishes to be accepted. He does not trust strangers nor seem to socialize with many [[villagers]]. He tells [[the Player]] of incidents in which his [[tent]] was vandalized or destroyed. During [[festivals]], he is usually alone and away from the main festivities.
  
 
Linus and the [[Wizard]] stand next to each other at the [[Spirit's Eve]] festival.
 
Linus and the [[Wizard]] stand next to each other at the [[Spirit's Eve]] festival.

entry.title: Deluxe Worm Bin
entry.summary:
Reverted edits by Mouahrara (talk) to last revision by Margotbean

← Older revision Revision as of 12:05, 29 March 2025
Line 8: Line 8:
 
}}
 
}}
 
:''See also: [[Worm Bin]].''
 
:''See also: [[Worm Bin]].''
−
The '''Deluxe Worm Bin''' is a [[Crafting|craftable item]] that can be used to create {{name|Deluxe Bait|class=inline|link=Deluxe Bait}} for [[fishing]]. The [[crafting]] recipe is unlocked at [[Fishing#Fishing Skill|Fishing level 8]].
+
The '''Deluxe Worm Bin''' is a [[Crafting|craftable item]] that can be used to create [[Deluxe Bait]] for [[fishing]]. The [[crafting]] recipe is unlocked at [[Fishing#Fishing Skill|Fishing level 8]].
  
 
The Deluxe Worm Bin automatically creates 4-5 pieces of deluxe bait every morning.
 
The Deluxe Worm Bin automatically creates 4-5 pieces of deluxe bait every morning.

entry.title: Talk:Railroad
entry.summary:
← Older revision Revision as of 12:04, 29 March 2025
Line 5: Line 5:
 
:I think I need to report this as a bug, actually. But in the meantime, please feel free to change the page and remove the incorrect information. We cannot add an entry to the history section, since the change happened sometime between 1.3 and 1.6, and we don't know which version.
 
:I think I need to report this as a bug, actually. But in the meantime, please feel free to change the page and remove the incorrect information. We cannot add an entry to the history section, since the change happened sometime between 1.3 and 1.6, and we don't know which version.
 
:Thanks so much for your comment, and your analysis of train mechanics! [[User:Margotbean|margotbean]] ([[User talk:Margotbean|talk]]) 18:06, 8 October 2024 (UTC)
 
:Thanks so much for your comment, and your analysis of train mechanics! [[User:Margotbean|margotbean]] ([[User talk:Margotbean|talk]]) 18:06, 8 October 2024 (UTC)
−
 
  
 
==Preventing Damage Taken from Train==
 
==Preventing Damage Taken from Train==
 
I just got run over by the train and shoved into the right exit. I noticed the train keeps moving when the game is paused (by opening the inventory), but the player doesn't take damage. So, I was able to survive with only minor damage. Can I add this information to the notes section? [[User:Cvrcek|Cvrcek]] ([[User talk:Cvrcek|talk]]) 04:42, 29 March 2025 (UTC)
 
I just got run over by the train and shoved into the right exit. I noticed the train keeps moving when the game is paused (by opening the inventory), but the player doesn't take damage. So, I was able to survive with only minor damage. Can I add this information to the notes section? [[User:Cvrcek|Cvrcek]] ([[User talk:Cvrcek|talk]]) 04:42, 29 March 2025 (UTC)
 +
:Already added it, thank you! [[User:Margotbean|margotbean]] ([[User talk:Margotbean|talk]]) 12:04, 29 March 2025 (UTC)

entry.title: Railroad
entry.summary:
← Older revision Revision as of 12:04, 29 March 2025
Line 84: Line 84:
  
 
==Notes==
 
==Notes==
−
*Standing in front of a train will cause damage to the player. Standing inside the right side of the train tunnel will cause the player to get stuck, and eventually pass out if their health is drained.
+
*Standing in front of a train will cause damage to the player. Standing inside the right side of the train tunnel will cause the player to get stuck, and eventually pass out if their health is drained. Opening the in-game player menu until the train passes can prevent damage in this case.
  
 
==External Links==
 
==External Links==

entry.title: Modding:Quest data
entry.summary:
Minor corrections about when counts or reaction texts are required.

← Older revision Revision as of 09:50, 29 March 2025
(6 intermediate revisions by the same user not shown)
Line 93: Line 93:
 
| style="text-align: center;" | 0
 
| style="text-align: center;" | 0
 
| Type
 
| Type
−
| Valid types are <code>Basic</code>, <code>Crafting</code>, <code>Location</code>, <code>Building</code>, <code>ItemDelivery</code>,<br/><code>Monster</code>, <code>ItemHarvest</code>, <code>LostItem</code>, <code>SecretLostItem</code>, and <code>Social</code><br/><br/><small>If a quest uses the <samp>Social</samp> type, it will always turn into the introduction quest that has you greet everyone in town, no matter what you wrote in the other fields.</small>
+
| Valid types are <code>Basic</code>, <code>Crafting</code>, <code>Location</code>, <code>Building</code>, <code>ItemDelivery</code>, <code>Monster</code>, <code>ItemHarvest</code>, <code>LostItem</code>, <code>SecretLostItem</code>*, and <code>Social</code><br/><br/><small>If a quest uses the <samp>Social</samp> type, it will always turn into the introduction quest that has you greet everyone in town, no matter what you wrote in the other fields.</small>
 
|-
 
|-
 
| style="text-align: center;" | 1
 
| style="text-align: center;" | 1
Line 109: Line 109:
 
| style="text-align: center;" | 4
 
| style="text-align: center;" | 4
 
| ''(Optional)'' Completion Requirements
 
| ''(Optional)'' Completion Requirements
−
| The format of this field will vary depending on the quest <samp>Type</samp>.
+
| The format of this field will vary depending on the quest <samp>Type</samp>. See [[Modding:Quest data#Completion Requirements|completion requirements]].
 
|-
 
|-
 
| style="text-align: center;" | 5
 
| style="text-align: center;" | 5
Line 128: Line 128:
 
|-
 
|-
 
| style="text-align: center;" | 9
 
| style="text-align: center;" | 9
−
| ''(Optional)'' Reaction Text<br/><small>This only applies to <samp>ItemDelivery</samp> and <samp>Monster</samp> quests.
+
| ''(Optional)'' Reaction Text<br/>Required for <samp>ItemDelivery</samp> quests as well as <samp>Monster</samp> quests when an NPC is specified. Not used in other quest types.</small>
 
| <samp>Wow, thanks for the Amethyst!
 
| <samp>Wow, thanks for the Amethyst!
 
|}
 
|}
 +
<small>*A <samp>SecretLostItem</samp> quest will be hidden from the player's quest log.</small>
 +
<br/>
  
−
When using the ItemDelivery quest type, you can specify an item quantity after the item ID.
+
===Completion Requirements===
  
−
Ex: "5200": "ItemDelivery/Rock Candy/Abigail wants you to bring her several amethysts./Bring Abigail 10 amethysts./'''Abigail 66 10'''/-1/300/-1/true/Thanks, these look delicious!"
+
The format of the '''completion requirements''' field will vary depending on what <samp>Type</samp> is listed in the first field:
 +
 
 +
{| class="wikitable"
 +
|-
 +
! Type
 +
! Format
 +
! Additional Info
 +
|-
 +
| <samp>Basic</samp>
 +
| <samp>N/A</samp>
 +
| A <samp>Basic</samp> quest is handled manually and it is up to you to complete it when appropriate.
 +
|-
 +
| <samp>Crafting</samp>
 +
| {{t|Item Id}} {{o|isBigCraftable}}
 +
| {{t|Item Id}} can be a qualified or unqualified item id. If it is unqualified, it will create either an [[Modding:Objects|Object]] or a [[Modding:Big_craftables|Big Craftable]] depending on {{o|isBigCraftable}} (default false).
 +
|-
 +
| <samp>Location</samp>
 +
| {{t|Location}}
 +
| The player must warp to the location in order to complete the quest, even if they have already visited it before receiving the quest.
 +
|-
 +
| <samp>Building</samp>
 +
| {{t|Building Type}}
 +
| If the player has already constructed at least one {{t|Building Type}}, the quest will be completed immediately.
 +
|-
 +
| <samp>ItemDelivery</samp>
 +
| {{t|NPC}} {{t|Item Id}} {{o|Count}}
 +
| {{t|Item Id}} can be a qualified or unqualified item id. {{o|Count}} defaults to 1.
 +
|-
 +
| <samp>Monster</samp>
 +
| {{t|Monster Name}} {{t|Count}} {{o|NPC}} {{o|ignoreFarmMonsters}}
 +
| If the monster name has spaces in it, they must be replaced with underscores (e.g. <code>Green Slime</code> becomes <code>Green_Slime</code>). If you specify an {{o|NPC}}, the player must talk to them after killing enough monsters in order to complete the quest. {{o|ignoreFarmMonsters}} defaults to <samp>true</samp>.
 +
|-
 +
| <samp>ItemHarvest</samp>
 +
| {{t|Item Id}} {{o|Count}}
 +
| {{t|Item Id}} can be a qualified or unqualified item id. {{o|Count}} defaults to 1.
 +
|-
 +
| <samp>LostItem</samp>
 +
| {{t|NPC}} {{t|Item Id}} {{t|Location}} {{t|x}} {{t|y}}
 +
| {{t|NPC}} is who the player must deliver the item to. {{t|Item Id}} can be a qualified or unqualified item id, however it ''must'' be an [[Modding:Objects|Object]]. {{t|x}} and {{t|y}} are the X and Y tile coordinates to place the item at inside the given {{t|Location}}. If provided, the NPC will use the <samp>Reaction Text</samp> field in the quest data, otherwise they will use default dialogue.
 +
|-
 +
| <samp>SecretLostItem</samp>
 +
| {{t|NPC}} {{t|Item Id}} {{t|Friendship}} {{o|Quest Id}}
 +
| {{t|NPC}} is who the player must deliver the item to. {{t|Item Id}} can be a qualified or unqualified item id. {{t|Friendship}} determines how many friendship points (not hearts) the player will receive upon delivering the item. If {{o|Quest Id}} is provided, then upon completing this quest, the game will ''remove'' the quest whose Id matches the given {{o|Quest Id}} from the player's active quest log without completing it.
 +
|}
  
 
Here is the string in an easy to edit format:<br />
 
Here is the string in an easy to edit format:<br />
  
−
ID(number): Type/Title/flavor text/Hint/Solution/Next quest (-1 if none)/Gold (0 if none)/Reward Description/Cancellable/Reaction Text(optional)
+
ID: Type/Title/Description/Hint/Requirement/Next Quests/Money Reward/-1/Cancellable/Reaction Text
  
 
==See also==
 
==See also==

The '''Deluxe Worm Bin''' is a [[Crafting|craftable item]] that can be used to create [[Deluxe Bait]] for [[fishing]]. The [[crafting]] recipe is unlocked at [[Fishing#Fishing Skill|Fishing level 8]].
+
The '''Deluxe Worm Bin''' is a [[Crafting|craftable item]] that can be used to create {{name|Deluxe Bait|class=inline|link=Deluxe Bait}} for [[fishing]]. The [[crafting]] recipe is unlocked at [[Fishing#Fishing Skill|Fishing level 8]].
  
 
The Deluxe Worm Bin automatically creates 4-5 pieces of deluxe bait every morning.
 
The Deluxe Worm Bin automatically creates 4-5 pieces of deluxe bait every morning.

:Thanks so much for your comment, and your analysis of train mechanics! [[User:Margotbean|margotbean]] ([[User talk:Margotbean|talk]]) 18:06, 8 October 2024 (UTC)
 
:Thanks so much for your comment, and your analysis of train mechanics! [[User:Margotbean|margotbean]] ([[User talk:Margotbean|talk]]) 18:06, 8 October 2024 (UTC)
 +
 +
 +
==Preventing Damage Taken from Train==
 +
I just got run over by the train and shoved into the right exit. I noticed the train keeps moving when the game is paused (by opening the inventory), but the player doesn't take damage. So, I was able to survive with only minor damage. Can I add this information to the notes section? [[User:Cvrcek|Cvrcek]] ([[User talk:Cvrcek|talk]]) 04:42, 29 March 2025 (UTC)
